name: Life expectation by sex at ages 0, 15, and 45 - OWID based on Hacker (2010) and the US Social Security Administration (2017)
title: Life expectation by sex at ages 0, 15, and 45 - OWID based on Hacker (2010) and the US Social Security Administration (2017)
description:
The Hacker (2010) data is used for the period 1780 to 1890. The year 1790 refers to the period 1790-99; see Table 8: New Life Tables for the White Population of the United States, 1780-1900 for the original data consulted for this period. 

The US Social Security Administration data is used from 1900 to today.

fields.name: Life expectation age 15, females (OWID)
fields.description: Life expectation for females aged 15. We add 15 years to obtain life expectation at birth rather than at the age of 15 to ensure consistency across variables following Goldin and Lleras-Muney (2018).

fields.description: Life expectation for males aged 15. We add 15 years to obtain life expectation at birth rather than at the age of 15 to ensure consistency across variables following Goldin and Lleras-Muney (2018).

fields.description: Life expectation for females aged 45. We add 45 years to obtain life expectation at birth rather than at the age of 45 to ensure consistency across variables following Goldin and Lleras-Muney (2018).

fields.name: Life expectation age 45, males (OWID)
fields.description: Life expectation for males aged 45. We add 45 years to obtain life expectation at birth rather than at the age of 45 to ensure consistency across variables following Goldin and Lleras-Muney (2018).
